argument.name: P
argument.description: A pointer variable with information about the form just opened.

item.name: .Style
item.description:
Indicates the mode of the form.
"Dialog" = the form was opened as a modal dialog.
"Form" = the form was opened as a modeless dialog.

item.name: .Pointer
item.description: A pointer to the form just opened. Note: If the 'dialog' option is used, the method does not return a pointer to the form (since the form is closed before the method returns).

item.name: .Cancel
item.description:
Indicates whether the Cancel button was pressed.
"Yes" = the user selected the Cancel button at the prompt for the Layout name.
"No" = the user did not press the Cancel button.

argument.name: layoutname
argument.description: Optional. If Layout_Name is not specified, or if a NULL value is specified, Alpha Anywhere displays a list of forms for the target table. The name of an embedded browse.

argument.name: style
argument.description:
Optional. Default = "" (Modeless)
"" = Opens a new instance of a form as a modeless dialog.
"Dialog" = Opens form as a modal dialog. This will not observe the onactivate()event, and will not process the selected record in the OnInit()event.
"Existing" = If the target form window is already open, then use that window. It will change the record shown in the existing window.

page.description: Zooms to a form view of the current active record in an embedded browse. Style is "" for normal, "dialog", or "existing"
page.discussion: The FORM.ZOOM_TO_RECORD() method opens a form and displays the current record in an embedded browse. Limitations: Desktop applications only.
